data.name: mbx_FrmEditFileData_WarningLatLongMustBeNumbers
data.value: This needs to have numbers only. Will default to zero.
data.comment: Warns the user that they've tried to assign a non-numeric value to latitude or longitude.

data.name: mbx_FrmEditFileData_InfoDataUpdated
data.value: Data Updated.
data.comment: File Info has been updated.

data.name: mbx_FrmEditFileData_ErrorInvalidSender
data.value: This will be a bug. Please file an issue on github and that the 'sender' was:
data.comment: Generic error message telling the user "something has gone wrong."

data.name: mbx_FrmEditFileData_ErrorAPIError
data.value: The app encountered errors communicating with the API. If you got an Unauthorised error, pls set your username as password in the settings.
data.comment: Error informing the user that there was something wrong while trying to talk to the GeoNames API

data.name: mbx_FrmEditFileData_WarningFileDisappeared
data.value: Your files seem to have disappeared.
data.comment: Warning that the file the user was trying to edit has disappeared (realistaically deleted in the background)

data.value: Please restart the app for the change to take place.
data.comment: Location: Settings

data.name: mbx_FrmImportExportGpx_FileOrFolderDoesntExist
data.value: The file or folder you picked is invalid.
data.comment: Location: Import/Export GPX

data.name: mbx_FrmImportExportGpx_AskUserWantsReport
data.value: Do you want to see the report on the import process?
data.comment: Location: Import/Export GPX

data.name: mbx_FrmPasteWhat_NoDateShiftToPaste
data.value: No values specified in the Copy Pool for DateTime Shift

data.name: mbx_FrmImportExportGpx_NoFileSelected
data.value: No files have been selected to import for.
data.comment: Location: Import/Export GPX

data.name: mbx_FrmMainApp_InfoFavouriteNotValid
data.value: The saved item you selected isn't valid
data.comment: Location: Favourites

data.name: mbx_FrmMainApp_InfoFavouriteNameCannotBeBlank
data.value: Name cannot be empty/blank
data.comment: Location: Favourites

data.name: mbx_FrmMainApp_InfoFavouriteSaved
data.value: Favourite saved OK
data.comment: Location: Favourites

data.name: mbx_FrmMainApp_InfoCahcedDataRemoved
data.value: If there was any, cached data for selected items has been removed.
data.comment: Shows when user requests to remove cached data from a file that had some.

data.name: mbx_FrmMainApp_InfoCahcedDataNotRemoved
data.value: No data has been removed. Either you didn't select valid items or the ones you picked didn't have cached data.
data.comment: Shows when user requests to remove cached data from a file that had none.

data.name: mbx_FrmMainApp_NoFavouritesDefined
data.value: You have no favourites defined. Add one using the buttons under the map.

data.name: mbx_HelperStaticExifNoAPI
data.value: Failed to reach the API - are you offline by any chance?

data.name: mbx_FrmSettings_dgv_CustomRules_ColumnCannotBeEmpty
data.value: All dropdown columns must have a non-empty value and also the "if" condition value must not be empty.
data.comment: Location: Rules

data.name: mbx_FrmSettings_dgv_CustomRules_CustomOutcomeCannotBeEmpty
data.value: If you pick "Custom" for Outcome then the Custom Outcome column must not be empty. If you close the Settings Form and this isn't fixed, your row will be deleted.
data.comment: Location: Rules

data.name: mbx_FrmImportNoStoredShiftValues
data.value: No "shift" values stored. Data will remain 0.
data.comment: Location: Import/Export GPX. This basically means that the user tried to apply a time shift (like shift by 1 hour or some such) but didn't specify how they wanted the shift to take place.

data.name: mbx_DirectoryElementCollection_ErrorParsing
data.value: Error while parsing folder to DirectoryElements

data.name: mbx_FrmMainApp_QuestionNoRowsFromAPI
data.value: The API query didn't return any valid information. Do you want to blank out the toponomy values?

data.name: mbx_FrmMainApp_WarningTooManyFilesSelected
data.value: Precisely 1 file must be selected.

data.name: mbx_GenericDone
data.value: Done.

data.name: mbx_GenericDoneRestartApp
data.value: Done - you will probably want to restart the app.

data.name: mbx_FrmMainApp_WarningMultipleImageFilesForXMP
data.value: Warning: the following sidecar files share names with multiple image files - data may have been misread:

data.name: mbx_FrmSettings_QuestionWhatToExport
data.value: Choose what to Export. Please note that the Export function exports data that is _in_ the database, or in other words has been saved. If you have pending changes in Settings then back out, save them (click OK in the Settings Form), then come back here.
data.comment: Location: Settings

data.name: mbx_FrmSettings_QuestionWhatToImport
data.value: Choose what to Import. Please note that upon successful completion of the Import process the relevant bits of the database will be overwritten. If something fails there will be a backup file of your db in your AppData folder.
data.comment: Location: Settings

data.name: mbx_FrmSettings_ErrorExportFailed
data.value: Exporting Failed:
data.comment: Location: Settings

data.name: mbx_FrmSettings_ErrorImportFailed
data.value: Importing Failed:
data.comment: Location: Settings

data.name: mbx_FrmMainApp_QuestionAddDraggedDataPointToFiles
data.value: Do you want to assign the coordinates to the selected file(s)?

data.name: mbx_GenericPathLikelyUTF
data.value: The file path likely contains UTF (non-standard, such as Asian, Cyrillic, etc.) characters and this may cause the error. Please make sure you have enabled the “Use Unicode UTF-8 for worldwide language support” feature. (refer to the Known Issues in the Readme for this)

data.name: mbx_FrmImportExportGpx_TrackContainsNoData
data.value: Failed to import Track overlay - found no relevant-looking data.
data.comment: Location: Import/Export GPX

data.name: mbx_FrmMainApp_QuestionDisableFlatMode
data.value: Flat Mode is turned on. Do you want to turn it off?
data.comment: Question relating to whether the user wants to retain the "Flat Mode" when moving to another folder (which would instruct the app to parse subfolders recursively)
